facts.1: National Pumpkin Day is celebrated on October 26th every year in the United States.
facts.2: Pumpkins are a type of squash and are native to North America.
facts.3: The largest pumpkin ever grown weighed over 2,600 pounds.

facts.1: Austrian National Day is celebrated on October 26th to commemorate the Declaration of Neutrality in 1955.
facts.2: On this day, Austria declared its permanent neutrality and became a sovereign state.
facts.3: The day is marked by various ceremonies, including a military parade and the opening of government buildings to the public.

facts.1: Intersex Awareness Day is observed on October 26th to raise awareness about intersex people and their rights.
facts.2: The day marks the anniversary of the first public demonstration by intersex people in North America in 1996.
facts.3: Intersex people are born with physical sex characteristics that do not fit typical binary notions of male or female bodies.
